Study Title: Phase 3 Study to Compare Efficacy and Safety of DHP107 vs. Taxol® in Patients With Metastatic or Recurrent Gastric Cancer
Brief Summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of DHP107 (Oral paclitaxel) in comparison to Taxol®(IV paclitaxel) in Patients With Metastatic or Recurrent Gastric Cancer After Failure of 1st Line Chemotherapy With Fluoropyrimidine +/- Platinum.
Primary Outcome Measures: Progression Free Survival, PFS is defined as the time From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or death, assessed up to 24 months., Participants will be followed until progression, an expected average of 4 months.
Secondary Outcome Measures: Overall Survival, OS is defined as the time from the date of inclusion to the date of death, regardless of the cause of death., Until 6 months after the last participant is enrolled, assessed up to 24 months.|Overall Response Rate, ORR is defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) (v.1.1) criteria., Participants will be followed every 6 weeks until progression, an expected average of 4 months.
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
